lexUnit.name: pout.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: push one's lips or bottom lip forward as an expression of petulant annoyance or in order to make oneself look sexually attractive.

sentence.text: Smallfry continued to pose before the mirror , smiling and pouting her lips in film-star kisses to the man in the yard while Buddie picked out an intricate melody on his guitar .
` And I 've reached the grim forties , " said Masha , pouting her lush red lips .
Madame shrugged and pouted her lips .
She shrugged that off lightly , pouting long lips .
Curtis pouted his thick lips .
Emily pouted her lips .
` She pouted her red-lipsticked lips and Kate laughed .
The young clerk pouted his lips as if he was going to object .
Then she 'll pout her lips and look cross , and you can still see her thinking : ` No , I 'm getting nowhere with that . "
` We have company for the day , " he added , and Candace pouted coyly .
` A good night 's sleep would do that just as well , " she pointed out , and saw him pout disapprovingly .
Her mouth pouted further , if that were possible .
Churchill 's lips pouted incredulously like a hooked fish , then his jaw dropped , until it sagged on to his chest .
As Shannon looked up she caught a coldly calculating glint in the actress 's green eyes , but it was gone before Marianne turned to Dane , her beautifully shaped mouth pouting prettily .
The boy pouted slightly , but nodded his head .
Anna 's mouth was pouting slightly , her left cheek was flushed by resting against the pillow , her hair was a stream of auburn fire .
She began to pout , drawing her bottom lip over those small protruding teeth .
Nic has flu , is exhausted and is sulking , pouting and staring blankly in the corner .
They wink , they pout , they gobble down the complimentary potato salad .
Her face pouted at them resentfully when Blanche asked if she was Sharon Philips .
He slept with his mouth open , lips pouting like a pig 's snout .
